intro: Beaumontia jerdoniana, commonly known as the Jerdon's beaumontia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its striking, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are clustered in panicles. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
